chess

Class Chess.Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Chess.Bishop, Chess.Black_Pawn, Chess.King, Chess.Knight, Chess.Queen, Chess.Rook, Chess.White_Pawn
    Enclosing class:
    Chess

    public abstract static class Chess.Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Piece is the abstract class that all pieces will extend and exists so that each piece can be controlled polymorphically, e.g., the main method can say piece.move(), the putsOwnKingInCheck method can say piece.check, etc.

    Each piece must store a String of its name, a char of its file (a-h), an int of its rank (1-8), and a boolean for its side: white_side == true for white or false for black.

    Each piece must also implement a move method, which throws an IllegalArgumentException if the position it is to move to indicated by the parameter is not valid, a check method that checks all the positions the piece can move to to see if it is placing the opponent's King in check, and an allValidMoves method that returns that piece's valid moves

    Author:
    Jake

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public abstract void move(java.lang.String move_to)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Move takes an input string of 2 characters composing of a file and a rank of the destination. Move always runs putsOwnKingInCheck before committing the move. Move also checks to see if the move has placed the opponent's king in check with checkForCheck method. If a move were valid and to be committed, the Piece's position on the global board is changed and its file and rank fields are updated. More specific descriptions of move exists for each class that extends Piece.
        Parameters:
        move_to - a two part String with the file and the rank that they are to move to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the move_to position is not valid

      • check

        public abstract boolean check(Chess.Piece[][] board)
        check checks the positions in the inputed board that this piece can capture in to see if the opponent side's King is there. In the checkForCheck method if check returns true, checkmate is called. Check does not call checkmate itself since the check may be in a temporary board used in testing like the ones used in allValidMoves method
        Parameters:
        board - the board the that check is being tested in. This can be the global board or a temporary board created in putsOwnKingInCheck for instance
        Returns:
        true if it is checking the opponent King, false otherwise

      • allValidMoves

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allValidMoves()
        Returns all the positions that this piece can move to as an ArrayList of Strings. Each String is 2 characters consisting of a file and a rank
        Returns:
        ArrayList of strings of FileRank format of all the places this piece can move to
